# aerospike-py

> High-performance Aerospike Python Client built in Rust (Sync/Async). Provides both synchronous and asynchronous APIs with zero-copy NumPy batch reads, OpenTelemetry tracing, and Prometheus metrics.

- [Full documentation](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/llms-full.txt): Complete documentation in a single file

## Getting Started

- [Contributing](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/contributing): Development setup, build, test, and code style guidelines.
- [Getting Started](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/getting-started): Install aerospike-py and connect to an Aerospike cluster in minutes.

## API Reference

- [Client](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/api/client): Complete API reference for the synchronous Client and asynchronous AsyncClient classes.
- [Constants](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/api/constants): All constants used across the aerospike-py API.
- [Exceptions](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/api/exceptions): Exception hierarchy and error handling patterns.
- [Query API](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/api/query-scan): Query and AsyncQuery class reference with predicates.
- [Types](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/api/types): NamedTuple return types and TypedDict input types.

## Guides

- [Admin Guide](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/admin): User and role management for security-enabled Aerospike clusters.
- [Error Handling](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/error-handling): Production error handling patterns for aerospike-py.
- [UDF Guide](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/udf): Register, execute, and remove Lua UDFs on the Aerospike server.
- [Client Configuration](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/client-config): Configure connections, timeouts, auth, and connection pools.
- [Migration from Official Client](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/migration): Migrate from aerospike-client-python (C-based) to aerospike-py (Rust-based).
- [Performance Tuning](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/performance-tuning): Tips for optimizing aerospike-py throughput and latency.
- [NumPy Batch Read Guide](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/numpy-batch): Use batch_read with numpy structured arrays for high-performance columnar analytics directly from Aerospike.
- [NumPy Batch Write Guide](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/numpy-batch-write): Use batch_write_numpy to write records directly from numpy structured arrays for high-performance bulk ingestion into Aerospike.
- [List & Map CDT Operations](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/operations): Atomic server-side List (31 ops) and Map (27 ops) collection data type operations via client.operate().
- [Read Operations](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/read): Get, select, exists, and batch read operations.
- [Write Operations](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/write): Put, update, delete, operate, batch operate, and optimistic locking.
- [Expression Filters](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/expression-filters): Server-side record filtering with 104+ composable expression functions.
- [Query Guide](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/guides/query-scan): Secondary index queries with predicates.

## Integrations

- [FastAPI Integration](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/integrations/fastapi): AsyncClient with FastAPI lifespan and dependency injection.
- [Logging](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/integrations/observability/logging): Rust-to-Python logging bridge for observing Aerospike client internals.
- [Prometheus Metrics](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/integrations/observability/metrics): Prometheus metrics for monitoring Aerospike operations.
- [Distributed Tracing](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/integrations/observability/tracing): OpenTelemetry distributed tracing for Aerospike operations.

## Performance

- [Performance Overview](https://kimsoungryoul.github.io/aerospike-py/docs/performance/overview)
